the ninth century was the spiritually freest period

Definition: in a false and spurious manner
Example: the lawyer argued spuriously that his client knew nothing of the burglary
a squarely cut piece of paper
looked him squarely in the eye
the black walls rose starkly from the snow
He was starkly unable to achieve coherence

Definition: at a steady rate or pace

Example: the street rose steeply up to the castle

Definition: with reference to action or condition
without moving or making a sound
Example: he sat still as a statue
he was stoutly replying to his critics

Definition: with strength or in a strong manner
Example: argues very strongly for his proposal
she remained stubbornly in the same position
he had stupidly bought a one way ticket
the image came to him subconsciously
you cannot look at these facts subjectively

Definition: in a lofty and exalted manner
Example: it is an enormous, fruit-packed wine, smelling sublimely of ripe blackcurrants

Senses: later afterwards  afterward  afte later on
Definition: happening at a time subsequent to a reference time

Example: late nineteenth-century French opera at its most beautiful, subtly romantic with a twilight melancholy
talked to each child in turn

Senses: all of a sudden of a sudden
Example: suddenly she felt a sharp pain in her side
she was sufficiently fluent in Mandarin

Senses: certainly sure  for sure  for certain  sure enough  sure as shooting
Definition: definitely or positively (`sure' is sometimes used informally for `surely')

Example: he was watching her surreptitiously as she waited in the hotel lobby

Definition: with respect to the sympathetic nervous system
in a systematic or consistent manner

Example: the tactically useful province is still firmly in the rebels' hands
the labour movement allowed itself to be run out of power tamely
ride tandem on a bicycle built for two

Definition: with regard to technical skill and the technology available

Example: the plain manner of its style all the more tellingly points up the horror of the case
we agreed tentatively on a dinner date
his works tenuously survive in the minds of a few scholars
thankfully he didn't come to the party

Definition: subsequently or soon afterward (often used as sentence connectors)
in that case or as a consequence
Example: if he didn't take it, then who did?

Definition: from that place or from there

Example: atomic formulas and all compounds thence constructible- W.V.Quine
he worked the problem out theoretically

Definition: in or at that place or location
Example: they have lived there for years

Definition: by that means or because of that
Example: He knocked over the red wine, thereby ruining the table cloth

Definition: (used to introduce a logical conclusion) from that fact or reason or as a result
(formal) in or into that thing or place
of or concerning this or that
Example: a problem and the solution thereof
with all the appurtenances fitting thereto

Definition: with that or this or it
Example: I have learned that whatever state I am, therewith to be content- Phil.:

Definition: spoken with poor articulation as if with a thick tongue
Example: after a few drinks he was beginning to speak thickly

Definition: in a small quantity or extent
Example: spread the margarine thinly over the meat

Definition: completely and absolutely (`good' is sometimes used informally for `thoroughly')

Example: he had thoughtfully brought with him some food to share
he stared thoughtfully out the window
he stared thoughtlessly at the picture
our rent increased threefold in the past five years
I called you thrice last night
got soaked through in the rain
this bus goes through to New York
the door gave access to a tidily furnished sitting-room where chintz and oak predominated

Definition: in a tight or constricted manner
on tiptoe or as if on tiptoe

Example: voted for unionization to a man

Senses: T to the letter just right  to perfection
Example: the new house suited them to a T

Definition: on this day as distinct from yesterday or tomorrow
Example: I can't meet with you today
we worked together on the project

Definition: in contact with each other or in proximity

Example: we went to the movies together

Definition: during the night of the present day

Example: tranquilly she went on with her work
you can use the verb `eat' transitively or intransitively

Definition: so as to allow the passage of light
Example: the red brilliance of the claret shines transparently in our glasses

Definition: so as to be easily understood or seen through

Example: we can prove trivially that this theorem is false

Definition: in accordance with truth or fact or reality

Example: I told him truthfully that I had just returned from my vacation
the price increased twofold last year

Senses: finally in the end  at last  at long last
Definition: as the end result of a succession or process
Example: ultimately he had to give in
the kidney stones were removed ultrasonically
The percentage of lead in our drinking water is unacceptably high
in the book, a tycoon unaccountably becomes the hero's friend
he unashamedly abandoned the project when he realized he would not gain from it
it was unbearably hot in the room
unbeknownst to me, she made all the arrangements
she lay on the couch, her body uncomfortably twisted
a common remedy is uncommonly difficult to find
she jumped up unconsciously when he entered the room

Definition: to an undeniable degree or in an undeniable manner
Example: she is undeniably the most gifted student in the class

Definition: in or into a state of subordination or subjugation
Example: we must keep our disappointment under

Definition: down to defeat, death, or ruin

Example: this will put the patient under
children six and under will be admitted free

Definition: with the hand swung below shoulder level
in the way and hindering progress
Example: a house with children and pets and toys always underfoot

Definition: beneath the surface of the earth
in or into hiding or secret operation
under or below an object or a surface
Example: at a lower place or level

Definition: on the lower or downward side

Example: the team chalked up another victory, the last one quite undeservedly, in my opinion
she was unduly pessimistic about her future
he unerringly fixed things for us

Definition: in an unequal or partial manner
in a way that was not expected
Example: her brother showed up at the wedding out of the blue
by means of one part or party
he could determine uniquely the properties of the compound
he was unjustly singled out for punishment

Definition: in an unkind manner or with unkindness
Example: The teacher treats the children unkindly
this watercolor is unmistakably a synthesis of nature

Definition: in a manner at variance with what is natural or normal
Example: The early Church not unnaturally adopted the position that failure to see the messianic character of his work was really caused by the people's own blindness
his other arm lay across his chest, unnaturally, as if placed there deliberately, for a purpose
this marathon would exhaust him unnecessarily
messengers were moving unobtrusively over the jet-black mountain ranges, bearing confidential tidings from sheikhdom to sheikhdom
unofficially, he serves as the treasurer
he had made some money on the side
Fred Winter is unquestionably the jockey to follow

Definition: to a degree that exceeds the bounds or reason or moderation
not in a reasonable or intelligent manner
Example: she reacted unreasonably when she learned she had failed
I can unreservedly recommend this restaurant

Definition: not in accordance with the season

Example: he acted unselfishly when he helped her get the promotion
he walked unsteadily toward the exit
she tried unsuccessfully to persuade him to buy a new car

Definition: to a remarkable degree or extent

Example: he had sinned against her unwillingly

Definition: spatially or metaphorically from a lower to a higher position

Example: they moved the meeting date up

Definition: to a more central or a more northerly place

Example: he walked up and grabbed my lapels

Definition: upward on a hill or incline
in or into the highest position
in or into the most prominent position, as in the mind
at or toward the rear of the stage

Senses: up the stairs on a higher floo

Definition: in or toward the northern parts of a state

Example: health care reform is needed urgently
extra money could be usefully spent on this project
the furniture was sitting around uselessly
she was staring vacantly into the room
he looked for her in vain
in a variable manner or to a variable degree
the alternatives that are variously represented by the participants

Definition: to an exceedingly great extent or degree
Example: He had vastly overestimated his resources
he vehemently denied the accusations against him
he had a habit of using nouns verbally
a gallery quite often is added to make use of space vertically as well as horizontally

Definition: indirectly, as, by, or through a substitute

Example: Virginia had defended her land victoriously

Definition: in essence or effect but not in fact
Example: the strike virtually paralyzed the city
an old woman advanced a few paces to shake her fist virulently in my face

Definition: out of your own free will
Example: he voluntarily submitted to the fingerprinting
the animals were killed wantonly for sport
the sailor watched the sky warily

Definition: to a wasteful manner or to a wasteful degree
Example: we are still prodigally rich compared to others

Definition: to a great degree or by a great distance
in a weak or feeble manner or to a minor degree
(often used as a combining form) in a good or proper or satisfactory manner or to a high standard (`good' is a nonstandard dialectal variant for `well')
to a suitable or appropriate extent or degree
in a manner affording benefit or advantage
to a great extent or degree
Example: I'm afraid the film was well over budget

Definition: with skill or in a pleasing manner

Example: You would do well to say nothing more

Definition: with great or especially intimate knowledge
(used for emphasis or as an intensifier) entirely or fully
to, toward, or in the west

Example: we began to steer away westerly- Daniel Defoe
they traveled westward toward the setting sun

Definition: on a large scale without careful discrimination

Example: I can sell it to you wholesale

Senses: entirely completely  totally  all  altogethe whole  right
Definition: to a complete degree or to the full or entire extent (`whole' is often used informally for `wholly')
to or over a great extent or range
with or by a broad space

Example: the arrow went wide of the mark

Definition: so as to leave much space or distance between
in a wild or undomesticated manner
to an extreme or greatly exaggerated degree

Example: attacked wildly, slashing and stabbing over and over

Definition: in an uncontrolled or unrestrained manner

Example: she acted wisely when she invited her parents
his sister would have looked beautiful in that dress, he thought wistfully, just like an angel
he would wittily chime into our conversation

Senses: wondrous wondrously  superbly  toppingly  marvellously  terrifically  marvelously

Definition: (comparative of `ill') in a less effective or successful or desirable manner
to the highest degree of inferiority or badness

Example: `I can't remember who I am,' I said, wretchedly

Definition: in an unjust or unfair manner
Example: the employee claimed that she was wrongfully dismissed
wouldst not play false and yet would wrongly win- Shakespeare
I therein do rejoice, yea, and will rejoice
I have yet to see the results

Definition: within an indefinite time or at an unspecified future time
Example: he longed for the flowers that were yet to show themselves

Definition: at or in an indicated (usually distant) place (`yon' is archaic and dialectal)

Example: she worked zealously to raise funds for the literacy project

Definition: in a zigzag course or on a zigzag path
Example: birds flew zigzag across the blue sky
